section.title: Plugin changes
section.p: 1. Updated the Wiki and Textile plugins to also check for metadata to specify whether or not processing should occur on a particular entry. You need to run the Meta plugin before either of these plugins in one of your plugin chains. The metadata key for the Wiki plugin would be specified as "meta-run-wiki=y" on a separate line in your blog entry text. The metadata key for the Textile plugin would be specified as "meta-run-textile=y" on a separate line in your blog entry text.

section.p:
1. Add the following to your /WEB-INF/(user-id)/blog.properties if you would like to enable auto-formatting of comments. This will turn all newline characters into
tags. plugin-comment-autoformat=true

section.title: Template changes
section.p: 1. Replace the atom.vm or atom.jsp file (as appropriate) in the templates directory for those users who have an Atom flavor enabled. Alternatively, users can login to edit their Atom template via the web administration interface and change the text for $entry.getCategory() in the <id> tag to $entry.getEncodedCategory().

2. Although this is not a required change, in your RSS 2.0 template, you can remove isPermalink="true" from the <guid> tag under the <item> element. By default, this attribute defaults to true, so you can save yourself some more bandwidth by removing it.

section.title: Properties file changes
section.p:
1. Add the following to your /WEB-INF/plugin.properties if you would like to enable web-based administration of blog users, authorization, and plugins.
edit-blog-users=org.blojsom.plugin.admin.EditBlogUsersPlugin edit-blog-authorization=org.blojsom.plugin.admin.EditBlogAuthorizationPlugin edit-blog-plugins=org.blojsom.plugin.admin.EditBlogPluginsPlugin

2. Add the following to your /WEB-INF/web.xml file under the init-params for BlojsomServlet if you are going to be using the administration plugin for editing blog users.
<init-param> <param-name>plugin-admin-edit-users</param-name> <param-value>/WEB-INF/plugin-admin-edit-users.properties</param-value> </init-param>

3. Add the following file to your /WEB-INF directory under the filename, plugin-admin-edit-users.properties if you are going to be using the administration plugin for editing blog users.
bootstrap-directory=/bootstrap blog-home-base-directory=/change/me/please administrators=default
bootstrap-directory is the location off your /WEB-INF directory where the bootstrap properties and templates directory is. This precludes you from adding a user named "bootstrap". If you would like to add a user named "bootstrap", change the directory name here and on disk appropriately. blog-home-base-directory is the directory where users blogs will be stored. A directory with the new user id will be created under this directory for users you add dynamically to your blojsom installation. administrators is a comma-separated list of users who are enabled to add and delete users from your blojsom installation.

4. Copy the bootstrap directory under your /WEB-INF directory so that you have a /WEB-INF/bootstrap directory and a /WEB-INF/bootstrap/templates directory. This is the directory that contains a bootstrap set of properties files and templates for adding new users to your blojsom installation.

section.p: 1. Replace the rss2.vm or rss2.jsp file (as appropriate) in the templates directory for those users who have an RSS2 flavor enabled. Added favorite icon support.

4. Add the following to your /WEB-INF/xmlrpc.properties to set a default handler for the XML-RPC servlet. The value for the "$default" key is the short name for one of the blojsom XML-RPC handlers.

section.title: Core (add-on) changes
section.p:
1. If you would like to develop templates using the FreeMarker template language, copy the freemarker-2.2.5.jar file to your /WEB-INF/lib directory. You will also need to add the following line to your /WEB-INF/dispatcher.properties file.
fm=org.blojsom.dispatcher.FreeMarkerDispatcher
Templates will need to have the .fm extension for them to be handled by the FreeMarker dispatcher. You will also need to make the appropriate changes to an individual user's flavor.properties to change any flavors to use FreeMarker templates.

2. If you are using the Caching fetcher, replace the oscache-*.jar in your /WEB-INF/lib directory with the updated oscache-2.0.1.jar file.

2. Remove the file.resource.loader.path parameter from your /WEB-INF/velocity.properties file. This parameter is now generated at runtime based on blojsom's global settings.

3. Add the folowing parameter to /WEB-INF/velocity.properties.
runtime.log.logsystem.class=org.blojsom.util.BlojsomSimpleLog4JSystem

section.title: Template changes
section.p: 1. If you are using the Atom templates to generate Atom feeds, copy the appropriate Atom template into your individual user's template directories.

section.title: Addon changes
section.p:
1. A caching fetcher is included in blojsom-addon-core.jar. If you would like to use this fetcher, do the following.
Copy the blojsom-addon-core.jar file into your /WEB-INF/lib directory.
Copy the oscache-2.0b2.jar file into your /WEB-INF/lib directory.
Copy the oscache.properties file into your /WEB-INF directory.
The caching fethcer uses /WEB-INF/oscache.properties as the default properties for OSCache. If you would like to change the filename used to initialize OSCache, you can add an init-param to web.xml with a param-name of oscache-properties and a param-value set to the new directory and filename. The new directory and filename must be set off your web application root directory.
A user property, caching-fetcher-refresh can be added to an individual user's blog.properties file to control the number of seconds before blojsom will refresh its cache.

2. A wiki formatting plugin is included in blojsom-addon-plugins.jar. If you would like to use this plugin, do the following.
Copy the blojsom-addon-plugins.jar file into your /WEB-INF/lib directory.
Copy the radeox-0.7.jar file into your /WEB-INF/lib directory.
Add the line wiki=org.blojsom.plugin.wiki.WikiPlugin to the global /WEB-INF/plugin.properties.
You may then add the wiki plugin shortname to the appropriate flavor-based plugin chains in a user's plugin.properties file.

section.title: General changes
section.p: 1. Change any classnames which reference the org.ignition.blojsom.* package to org.blojsom.*. You will find classnames in the following files, blojsom.properties, dispatcher.properties, plugin.properties, and blojsom-xmlrpc.properties.

section.title: Create an initial user
section.p: 1. Create a sub-directory in the directory where blojsom is unpackaged for this initial user. For example, if we are creating a default user, create /WEB-INF/default.

2. Move the /WEB-INF/blojsom.properties to the new user's directory under the name blog.properties. If you were creating a default user, you would be moving /WEB-INF/blojsom.properties to /WEB-INF/default/blog.properties.

3. Create a new /WEB-INF/blojsom.properties file with general configuration properties for blojsom. For example:
# # blojsom main configuration file # blojsom-users=default blojsom-default-user=default blojsom-configuration-base-directory=/WEB-INF/ blojsom-fetcher=org.blojsom.fetcher.StandardFetcher blojsom-templates-directory=/templates/

4. Move the authorization.properties, blacklist.filters, and flavor.properties files to the initial user's directory. So, for example, these would be moved to /WEB-INF/default. If you are using any of the plugins which require configuration files (Emoticons, Macro Expansion, Referer Log, or Show Me More), you may also move the plugin-specific configuration files ( emoticons.properties, macros.properties, referer.properties, and showmemore.properties) into the initial user's directory.

5. Copy the /WEB-INF/plugin.properties to the initial user's directory. For example, if using the default user as above, you would now have a copy of the file in /WEB-INF/plugin.properties and /WEB-INF/default/plugin.properties. Edit /WEB-INF/plugin.properties so that this file only contains plugin short name and class references. This file should not contain any blojsom-plugin-chain references. Edit /WEB-INF/default/plugin.properties so that this file only contains blojsom-plugin-chain references. blojsom will ignore the information it does not need from these respective files, but for cleanliness and readability, you should remove the appropriate information from the respective files.
6. Change the blog-blacklist-file parameter in the user's blog.properties from /WEB-INF/blacklist.filters to blacklist.filters.

section.title: Copy templates for the initial user
section.p: 1. Create a directory called templates in the initial user's directory. In the default user example above, this would be /WEB-INF/default/templates.
2. Move the appropriate Velocity or JSP templates into the initial user's template directory. You do not need to move any of the CSS files or image button files.

section.title: Modify the Velocity configuration
section.p:
1. Use the sample below for your /WEB-INF/velocity.properties file. The one change you will need to make is for the file.resource.loader.path which contains the path where blojsom is installed.
# # blojsom Velocity dispatcher configuration file # # Tell Velocity which resource loader we are using # resource.loader=file, class #
# # File resource loader information # file.resource.loader.description=Velocity File Resource Loader file.resource.loader.class=org.apache.velocity.runtime.resource.loader.FileResourceLoader file.resource.loader.path=/change/me/to/the/directory/where/blojsom/is/unpacked/ file.resource.loader.cache=true file.resource.loader.modificationCheckInterval=60
# # Class resource loader information # class.resource.loader.description=Velocity Classpath Resource Loader class.resource.loader.class=org.apache.velocity.runtime.resource.loader.ClasspathResourceLoader class.resource.loader.cache=true class.resource.loader.modificationCheckInterval=0

section.title: Changes to web.xml for the BlojsomServlet
section.p: 1. Change the blog-configuration init-param to blojsom-configuration. This parameter's value will stay /WEB-INF/blojsom.properties.
2. Change the blog-flavor-configuration init-param to flavor-configuration. Change the parameter value to flavor.properties.
3. Change the dispatcher-map-configuration init-param to dispatcher-configuration. This parameter's value will stay /WEB-INF/dispatcher.properties.
4. Change the blog-plugin-configuration init-param to plugin-configuration. Change the parameter value to plugin.properties.
5. Change the value of the blog-authorization init-param to authorization.properties.
6. If you are using the Macros Expansion Plugin, change the value of the plugin-macros-expansion init-param to macros.properties.
7. If you are using the Show Me More Plugin, change the value of the plugin-showmemore init-param to showmemore.properties.
8. If you are using the Emoticons Plugin, change the value of the plugin-emoticons init-param to emoticons.properties.
9. If you are using the Referer Log Plugin, change the value of the plugin-referer init-param to referer.properties.

section.title: Changes to web.xml for the BlojsomXMLRPCServlet
section.p: 1. Change the blog-configuration init-param to blojsom-configuration. This parameter's value will stay /WEB-INF/blojsom.properties.
2. Change the value of the blog-authorization init-param to authorization.properties.

section.title: Changes to web.xml for the CommentAPIServlet
section.p: 1. Change the blog-configuration init-param to blojsom-configuration. This parameter's value will stay /WEB-INF/blojsom.properties.

section.title: Upgrading from blojsom 1.9.4 to blojsom 1.9.5
section.p: Add the following parameter, blog-trackbacks-enabled with a value of true to /WEB-INF/blojsom.properties if you want to keep trackbacks enabled on your blog.

section.title: Upgrading from blojsom 1.9.3 to blojsom 1.9.4
section.p: If you are using the MetaWeblog API handler for blojsom, there are 3 parameters you'll need to add to /WEB-INF/blojsom.properties. blojsom-extension-metaweblog-upload-directory: location where files can be uploaded through the newMediaObject method blojsom-extension-metaweblog-accepted-types: comma-separated list of mime-types accepted for the newMediaObject method blojsom-extension-metaweblog-static-url-prefix: url prefix used to generate the return URL for the newMediaObject method

section.title: Upgrading from blojsom 1.9.2 to blojsom 1.9.3
section.p: No changes required

section.title: Upgrading from blojsom 1.9.1 to blojsom 1.9.2
section.p: No changes required
